passages.text:
2Q25 missed expectation due to trading drag and NIM compression;
DY lower-than-peers despite no dilution risk in 2025E

ABC reported 1H25 PPOP decline of -0.2% y-y to RMB258.1bn and 1H25 NPAT up +2.7% y-y to RMB139.5bn, which is below our preview expectation (forming 51% of FY25E consensus estimate). 2Q25 PPOP growth remains muted, flat y-y (vs. -0.3% y-y in 1Q25), dragged by trading gain (-22% y-y) and NIM compression, while 2Q25 NPAT growth came in faster at +3.2% y-y to reach RMB67.6bn (vs. +2.2% y-y in 1Q25) thanks to lower credit cost (-13bp y-y). ROA/ROE fell -3bp/-43bp y-y to 0.59%/10.2% in 2Q25. ABC declared an interim DPS of RMB0.1195 for 1H25 (up +2.7% y-y), with unchanged payout ratio at 30%. The bank is in the second batch of Big6 banks recapitalization; hence we expect the potential equity dilution delayed to 2026E.

**Key Positives** — Loan growth was resilient, +2.2% q-q/+9.6% y-y in 2Q25 (vs. +5.0% q-q/+9.4% y-y in 1Q25), driven by i) discount bills (+22.1% q-q in 2Q25), ii) corporate loan growth (+1.4% q-q in 2Q25), likely thanks to strong lending into software /construction/ retail wholesale trade sectors with loan balance up +32.3%/+21.8%/+15.8% h-h in 1H25, and iii) retail loan growth (+0.4% q-q in 2Q25), likely thanks to decent growth in personal consumption/credit card loan growth (+13.2%/+6.0% h-h in 1H25) more than offsetting the drag from mortgage loan balance shrinkage (-1.0% h-h in 1H25). With resilient loan growth (+2.2% q-q) outpacing deposit (-0.4% q-q) in 2Q, LDR was brought up by +2.13ppt q-q to 83.8% in 2Q25. Fee income accelerated to +32.4% y-y in 2Q25 (vs. -3.5% y-y in 1Q25) likely thanks to surged agency fee income (+62.3% y-y in 1H25), amid more favorable investor sentiment. (Continued)
Price (29 Aug 25 16:10)HK\(5.25Target priceHK\(5.81Expected share price10.7%returnExpected dividend yield4.8%Expected total return15.4%Market CapHK\(1,837,411M US\)235,756M

Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the Firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.

Key Negatives — NIM compressed - 4bp q-q to 1.30% in 2Q25, likely dragged by lower asset yield (- 4bp q-q by our estimate, likely due to weak credit demand and ongoing loan repricing), more than offsetting the positive from lower funding cost (- 5bp q-q in 2Q, per our estimate, possibly thanks to past deposit rate cut bearing fruit). Dealing gain was mixed, +2.9% q-q / - 22% y-y in 2Q25 to account for 7.9% of total operating income (- 2.35ppt y-y) mainly due to high base of 2Q24. Asset quality: 2Q25 NPL ratio was flat q-q 1.28% in 2Q25, mainly due to opposing asset quality trend in corporate vs. retail loan book; with lower corporate NPL ratio of 1.45% in 1H25 (- 13bp h-h driven by construction / manufacturing / retail and wholesale sector NPL ratio reduction by - 35bp/- 27bp/- 25bp h-h in 1H25), help offsetting the negative from retail NPL ratio increase by +14bp h-h to 1.18% in 1H25 (w/ higher NPL ratio observed mainly in mortgage/credit card loan book, +4bp/+5bp h-h to 0.77%/1.51% in 1H25). However, after adding back write offs, gross NPL formation rate edged up slightly to 0.57% in 2Q25 (+2bp y-y). Meanwhile, we note mixed asset quality trend with SML ratio decline by - 1bp h-h to 1.39% in 1H25, while overdue >3month loan ratio edged up +4bp h-h to 0.82% in 1H25. Despite mixed asset quality trend, ABC charged a lower credit cost of 62bp in 2Q25 (- 28bp q-q / - 13bp y-y), which brought down NPL coverage ratio modestly by - 2.81ppt q-q to 295.0% in 2Q25. CIR increased by +0.75ppt y-y to 32.6% due to both revenue weakness (+1.1% y-y only in 2Q25) and increased OPEX (+3.5% y-y in 2Q). CET- 1/tier- 1/total CAR were down - 12bp / - 32bp / - 34bp q-q to 11.11%/13.04%/17.45% in 2Q25 likely due to FY24 dividend payout.

Implication - ABC- A has been re- rated notably by 12.9% over the past 30days, far outperforming the CSI banks index (down - 2.1% during the same period). With high expectation on ABC, we think market would react negatively to ABC's muted 2Q25 PPOP growth (flat y- y, ranking the lowest among Big6 banks), while its 2Q25 NPAT growth of 3.2% y- y is also below expectation, falling behind that of PSBC's earnings growth of +4.8% y- y in 2Q25. Despite ABC is not facing equity dilution risk in 2025E, given the bank is in the second batch of Big6 banks recapitalization, we note that after significant re- rating, ABC- A/ABC- H's dividend yield of 3.3%/4.7% no longer looks attractive vs. Big6 bank peers. Factoring in potential equity dilution from recapitalization in 2026E (c.11.4% on our estimate), ABC- A/- H 26E dividend yield would be even lower at 3.0%/4.3%.

Agricultural Bank of China (ABC) was established in 1951 as an agricultural cooperative bank. In 1994, ABC transferred its policy- related banking business to the Agriculture Development Bank of China. In 1996, after separating administrative relations with rural credit cooperatives, ABC gradually became a state- owned commercial bank, providing credit support for agriculture businesses and increasing urban financial business needs. ABC underwent its first recapitalization and NPL carve- out in 1998- 99. On October 21, 2008, the State Council approved ABC's joint stock reform implementation. Subsequently, ABC completed a number of financial restructurings, before it was formally converted into a joint stock limited company from a state- owned commercial bank on January 15, 2009. ABC was listed in HK on 16th July 2010. ABC is the third largest bank in China by total assets, but the largest in terms of number of branches and retail customers. The bank operates over 23,600 domestic branch outlets across developed and under- developed areas of China - its key differentiating feature.

We have a Buy rating on ABC H- shares, as it has one of the lowest exposures to off- balance- sheet activities among Chinese banks, and has the strongest liquidity and deposit franchise in the sector. The bank also has the strongest provision buffers in the sector, with excess provisions amounting to \(c.2\%\) of the loan book.

We use an Economic Value Added (EVA) model to determine our target price of HK\$5.81 for ABC H- shares. EVA is commonly used to value banks, especially when rate liberalization has kicked off and ROE is likely to drop. Our assumptions include a sustainable ROE of \(9\%\) and long- term growth of \(3\%\) . We adopt a cost of equity of \(11.2\%\) , which suggests a fair FY26 P/B of \(0.63x\) .

Key downside risks that could mean the shares fail to achieve our EVA- based target price include: 1) deposit cost hike; 2) loss of deposit market share due to interest rate liberalization; and 3) weaker economic growth in rural areas.

One factor in equity research analyst compensation is arranging corporate access events between institutional clients and the management teams of covered companies. Typically, company management is more likely to participate when the analyst has a positive view of the company.

Guide to Citi Research Fundamental Research Investment Ratings: Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of 15% or more or 25% or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "—" and "–" respectively in the rating history price

chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re- establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short- term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds \(15\%\) against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
